symptoms_patient_terms: Sharp pain with cold or sweets
Pain when biting or releasing bite
Zings on exposed root near gum line

differentials.name: Reversible pulpitis
clues: Often early cavity or exposed dentin

differentials.name: Cracked tooth
clues: History of grinding or chewing hard foods

differentials.name: Sinus-related pain (upper molars)
clues: Multiple upper back teeth ache together

probable_causes: High bite on a new filling/crown
investigations: Check bite (occlusion) and cracks with special light
do_now: Avoid very hot/cold foods and sweets
Use a desensitizing toothpaste twice daily
Take only doctor-advised pain relievers if needed
donts: Do not apply heat to the face
Do not start antibiotics on your own
Do not delay if pain is getting worse or keeps you up at night

professional_care.name: Filling
professional_care.what_it_does: Removes decay and seals the tooth

professional_care.name: Root Canal (RCT)
professional_care.what_it_does: Cleans infection in the nerve space and saves the tooth
cons: Needs a crown in many cases

professional_care.name: Crown / Onlay
professional_care.what_it_does: Covers and strengthens cracked or heavily restored tooth

professional_care.name: Fluoride/desensitizers
professional_care.what_it_does: Seals exposed dentin to reduce sensitivity

urgency_modifiers.why: Lasting pain needs evaluation to prevent worsening
Fever with tooth pain can indicate spreading infection
Check sinus vs tooth source in upper molars

pregnancy_nursing: Some medicines are avoided—inform your dentist
systemic_notes: On blood thinners: do not stop them on your own
CKD: confirm safe pain medicine with your physician

prevention: Floss or use interdental brushes daily
Limit frequent sugars and acidic drinks
